# GitHub Copilot Instructions for CreatireBreeding

## Repository Overview

This repository contains the CreatireBreeding (Creature Breeding) project. It is currently in early development stages.

## Development Guidelines

### General Principles
- Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
- Follow industry best practices for the chosen technology stack
- Ensure all code changes include appropriate error handling
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

### Code Style
- Use consistent indentation (prefer spaces over tabs)
- Write descriptive variable and function names
- Include comments for complex logic, but prefer self-documenting code
- Follow the existing code style in the repository

### Version Control
- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits atomic and focused on a single change
- Use conventional commit format when applicable (e.g., `feat:`, `fix:`, `docs:`)

## Testing Requirements

- Add unit tests for new functionality
- Ensure all tests pass before submitting changes
- Maintain or improve existing test coverage
- Test edge cases and error conditions

## Build and Deployment

- Ensure all dependencies are properly documented
- Verify that the project builds successfully after changes
- Document any new build steps or requirements
- Keep build scripts and configuration files up to date

## Documentation

- Update README.md when adding new features or making significant changes
- Document public APIs and interfaces
- Include usage examples for new functionality
- Keep documentation in sync with code changes

## Security Considerations

- Never commit sensitive information (API keys, passwords, tokens)
- Validate and sanitize all user inputs
- Follow security best practices for the chosen technology stack
- Review dependencies for known vulnerabilities

## Best Practices for Copilot

- Provide clear, specific issue descriptions when requesting changes
- Include acceptance criteria for new features
- Specify which files or components need modification
- Review all generated code before merging
- Test thoroughly in a local environment when possible
